testimony.quarrel_subject: Hocquart's horse was frightened while he was passing the barn where servants were threshing, throwing him and dislocating his arm. He cursed the servants and Baguel. Next day dispute over work for carts from Germany.
Found Mengeotte beating one of his calves in his field, perhaps because it strayed. He put her out of the field.

More than 20 years ago when marriageable, Jeanotte (mother of Catherine and Mengeotte) wanted him to court Catherine. He refused because mother and daughter were already feared as witches. They were angry.

4 years before, his son and Hocquart's son went to the mountain to help carters. They played while waiting. On return Hocquart's son told his mother he had been beaten, and Mengeotte came to threaten.
Just under a year before, drinking at house of Sr. Baguel, Claude Hocquart joined them and refused to pay his share.
12 years before, quarrel with Mengeotte arising from her husband cutting down a hedge. Called her witch. 7-8 years back, wife was guarding horses and one strayed into Hocquart's land.
9 years before his horse had mated with Hocquart's mare. Mengeotte was angry.
testimony.threat_quote: que le diable le prenne... qu'il ne le meneroit plus guere loing sondit cheval

testimony.quarrel_subject: Around previous Easter, a foal had followed one of her horses
Gathered herbs for her animals from between two pieces of land belonging to Catherine. While drying millet with Catherine, Catherine cursed the animals that ate the herbs.
testimony.threat_quote: mal proffit puisse faire le bestail que avoit mangé lesdites herbes

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mengeotte found one of his pregnant sows doing damage in his meix and brought it back
testimony.threat_quote: que nul proffict il puisse tirer du fruict de ladits truye

timeline.subject: Claude, Mengeotte, and Catherine Hocquart
timeline.details: Substitut Nicolas Rouyer of Procureur General des Vosges orders Prevost of Arches to undertake preliminary investigation based on bad reputation at Bussang

timeline.subject: Witnesses 1-3
timeline.details: First depositions: Michel Baguel, Nicolas Blaise Ribelet, Nicolas Henry

timeline.subject: Three suspects
timeline.details: Order for arrest of three suspects

timeline.subject: Witnesses 10-11
timeline.details: Renewed depositions: Jean Simonin, Claudon Xalley

timeline.subject: Catherine and Mengeotte
timeline.details: Interrogation by Philippe Pironel, Prevôt d'Arches. Both denied accusations.

timeline.subject: Witnesses 13-14
timeline.details: Depositions of Adrienne femme de Jean Colin and Jean Thiebauld Colin

timeline.subject: All three accused
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses. No serious admissions. Mengeotte became angry, called witnesses 'gros menteur'. Claude claimed Brice Thiebauld had made reparation to him.

timeline.subject: Mengeotte and Catherine
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agreed to torture of Mengeotte and Catherine. Claude could also be tortured if they accused him.

timeline.subject: Mengeotte and Catherine
timeline.details: Both tortured. Mengeotte withstood thumbscrews and first stage on rack, then confessed. Catherine withstood thumbscrews, was confronted with sister, then confessed after being racked.

timeline.subject: Mengeotte and Catherine
timeline.details: Sentence of death on the two sisters

timeline.subject: Mengeotte and Catherine
timeline.details: Execution of the two sisters. Claude was not executed.

accomplices_named.context: Named by both Mengeotte and Catherine as being at the Sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Demenge Gamel
accomplices_named.context: Named by Mengeotte as being at the Sabbat, but she said she only saw him once and 'sometimes they had false faces'

accomplices_named.name: Catherine sa soeur (Mengeotte's sister)
accomplices_named.context: Named by Mengeotte as being at the Sabbat (this is Catherine Hocquart, co-accused)

accomplices_named.name: Colas de la Reine
accomplices_named.context: Named by Mengeotte as being at the Sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Wife of Jean Thiebault
accomplices_named.context: Catherine heard she had been accused in Germany

prior_accusations.context: Hocquart's grandmother had died in prison at Arches (prior witch trial)
Jeanotte Germain (mother of Mengeotte and Catherine) was suspected of being a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Michel Baguel to his servants
notable_quotes.french: ilz avoient mal faict, et que mal luy en prendroit
notable_quotes.english: they had done wrong, and that evil would come to him

notable_quotes.speaker: Michel Baguel to his servant
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne debvoit prendre dispute avec tels gens qui n'avoient poinct de bon bruict
notable_quotes.english: that he should not take dispute with such people who had no good reputation
notable_quotes.context: Warning servant not to quarrel with Hocquart

notable_quotes.speaker: Brice Grand Claude
notable_quotes.french: sorcier double sorcier, et qu'il estoit content qu'on le meust avec luy a Arches comme partye formelle
notable_quotes.english: witch, double witch, and that he was content to be taken with him to Arches as formal party

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Blaise Ribelet
notable_quotes.english: she had threatened him that he would repent of it
notable_quotes.context: After putting Mengeotte out of his field

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Henry to Catherine's sister
notable_quotes.french: Sorciere si tu ne guerite mon garçon que tu as touché, J'en avertiray Monsieur le Prevost
notable_quotes.english: Witch, if you do not cure my boy whom you have touched, I will inform Monsieur the Prevost
notable_quotes.context: After his son fell ill following Catherine's sister touching him

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Gané to Mengeotte
notable_quotes.french: Quoy sorcière nous vient tu icy menasser
notable_quotes.english: What, witch, do you come here to threaten us
notable_quotes.context: When Mengeotte came to threaten after quarrel about sons

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte to Jean Simonin
notable_quotes.french: que le diable le prenne... qu'il ne le meneroit plus guere loing sondit cheval
notable_quotes.english: may the devil take him... he would not lead his horse much longer
notable_quotes.context: Angry that his horse mated with her mare

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine Hocquart
notable_quotes.french: mal proffit puisse faire le bestail que avoit mangé lesdites herbes
notable_quotes.english: may the animals that ate the herbs have bad profit
notable_quotes.context: Cursing Adrienne's animals that ate herbs from her land

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte to Jean Thiebauld Colin
notable_quotes.french: que nul proffict il puisse tirer du fruict de ladits truye
notable_quotes.english: that he could draw no profit from the fruit of the sow
notable_quotes.context: Returning his pregnant sow that had damaged her field

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte under torture about accomplices
notable_quotes.french: quelquefois ils avoient de faulx visages
notable_quotes.context: Explaining uncertainty about identifying people at Sabbat

relationships.evidence_text: Catherine femme Romain Hocquart... widow of Romain Hocquart
Mother had been called Jeanotte Germain
Mother had been called Jeanotte Germain
widow of Demenge Hocquart (referring to Jeanotte as widow)
his field adjoining one belonging to the Hocquarts
his father had died after a quarrel with Mengeotte

economic_context.details: Claude Hocquart was removed from office of Chastellier (church officer) after being publicly called a witch without seeking redress. Multiple disputes over land boundaries, animals straying into fields, work for hire (carts from Germany), and a drinking dispute where Claude refused to pay his share. Arbitration resulted in Claude being ordered to pay over 100 francs. Several quarrels involved animals damaging property (calves straying, sows in fields, horses in land).

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, tried to bite ground and anything else, after 3-4 weeks died 'like mad/rabid'. Dogs would not eat body.
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Hocquart's horse frightened by threshing servants, threw him, dislocated his arm. He cursed them. Next day dispute over cart work.

harms_catalog.victim_name: eleven calves (belonging to Nicolas Blaise Ribelet)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Found Mengeotte beating one of his calves in his field. He put her out. She threatened he would repent.

harms_catalog.victim_name: 4 year old son of Nicolas Henry
harms_catalog.harm_description: so strangely ill and given up for dead; cured two days after witness threatened to inform Prevost
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeotte's sister had touched and caressed the child, saying 'voila un beau garcon'

harms_catalog.harm_description: tremendously swollen in body and genitals, remained so for ten weeks; cured in 4 weeks after eating turnips from their field
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: More than 20 years ago, refused to court Catherine when her mother Jeanotte wanted him to. They were angry. At a funeral feast, mother sent Catherine to give him a dish of beans.
His son and Hocquart's son went to help carters, played together while waiting. Hocquart's son claimed he was beaten. Mengeotte came to threaten. Witness called her witch.
Quarrel 12 years before arising from her husband cutting down a hedge. Called her witch, she said he would repent.
7-8 years back, wife was guarding horses and one strayed into Hocquart's land
9 years before, his horse had mated with Hocquart's mare. Mengeotte was angry and cursed him and the horse.

harms_catalog.harm_description: died after quarrel, believed she gave him the sickness

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Gathered herbs from between Catherine's land for her animals. Catherine wished harm on the animals that ate them.

harms_catalog.victim_name: litter of piglets (belonging to Jean Thiebauld Colin)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mengeotte found his pregnant sow doing damage in her field, returned it with curse

material_culture.context: Used for work, hired out to pull carts from Germany
Growing in field, eaten for magical cure
Property boundary, cut down causing quarrel
Gathered from land for feeding animals

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, residence of all accused and most witnesses
Location of court and prison where grandmother died
Residence of witness Brice Thiebauld Grand Claude
Origin of carts for commercial transport work
Where calves were kept and strayed
Where turnips grew, where sow did damage
Where boys went to help carters
Where Claude held office of Chastellier before removal
Where grandmother died, where accused were held for 37 days
Location of Change de Nancy court that approved torture

economic_hardship_indicators: disputes over animal damage to fields
multiple deaths of valuable livestock (horses, calves, sows)
religious_calendar_references: Easter (mentioned as time marker for quarrel)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Quarrel over drinking tab - Claude refused to pay his share at Sr. Baguel's house, was publicly called witch
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Went to arbitration by Demenge Grand Demenge and others, Claude ordered to pay over 100 francs

legal_context.redress_outcome: Never sought legal redress despite being repeatedly and publicly called witches. This failure to defend reputation was taken as evidence of guilt. Pastor and inhabitants removed Claude from church office of Chastellier specifically because he did not seek redress.
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: 37 days in prison at Arches. Gaoler paid 2 gros per person per day. Record notes they needed special treatment 'because of their old age' and because it was winter.

hearsay_chains.source: the two sisters and their mother
hearsay_chains.content: long before he had heard the two sisters calling one another witch, in company of their mother
Often accused, as by Colas Blaise, who said Claude had killed some of his horses
she had heard talk of Magdelaine femme Mengin Collatte, and the wife of Jean Thiebault who had been accused in Germany

emotional_state_notes: Mengeotte became angry during confrontations, called witnesses 'gros menteur' (big liar)
Failed to say paternoster in Latin (Mengeotte)

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Claude claimed Brice Thiebauld had made reparation to him and had an 'act' to prove it

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a complex multi-accused trial with extensive witness testimony. The case is notable for: (1) three family members accused together (husband, wife, and wife's sister); (2) multi-generational witch reputation (grandmother died in prison at Arches, mother suspected); (3) extensive evidence based on failure to seek legal redress for defamation; (4) only the two sisters were executed - Claude was not; (5) confessions obtained only under torture; (6) 50-year reputation span mentioned; (7) pattern of quarrel-threat-harm across multiple witnesses; (8) animals as primary targets of alleged maleficia; (9) torture confessions naming multiple accomplices; (10) imprisonment conditions explicitly noted due to age and winter season. The outcome indicates Claude was released while his wife and sister-in-law were executed.
